bioghist.p: Rev. Dr. Hugh Ivan Evans (1887-1958) was born in Ohio and was pastor of the Westminster Church in Dayton for 26 years. Evans received his B.D. from Princeton Theological Seminary in 1912 and D.D. from the College of Wooster in 1925. He was Moderator of the General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A., 1950-1951; President of Board of Trustees of Lane Theological Seminary; trustee of the College of Wooster; trustee of McCormick Theological Seminary; and trustee of Ohio Presbyterian Homes.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes sermons, 1921-1953; notebooks from Princeton Theological Seminary, 1910-1912; addresses and articles by Evans as Moderator; 1955-1958; correspondence of Evans related to Westminster Church; and folders on various pastorates, including correspondence. There are also scrapbooks on Evans' career from 1912-1958 that include newspaper and magazine clippings, photographs, bulletins and programs, invitations, and announcements. Specific volumes include: 1950-1951 travel to Cuba, Latin America, and Alaska; 1915 election as Moderator; retirement volume of correspondence; 1934 clippings of writings during trip to Europe and Russia; and a post-war photo album of Germany, Switzerland, and the Netherlands. Other items include correspondence of Mrs. Evans related to Rev. Evans' death; an "in memoriam" volume; a published history of Westminster Church (1949); and a reel to reel audio tape of a 1955 tribute program for Evans. Travel-related materials include printed "Letters from Dr. Evans" from a trip to Chile in 1950, a motion picture film of trip to South America, and miscellaneous travel brochures, maps and correspondence related to overseas visits.
